body_html: This will be useful, but probably won't be implemented in near future. As is with most autodiff systems, PyTorch has the derivatives formulas for ops written as efficient mappings that do g y -> gx = \{ \sum_i g y_i * d y_i / d x_j \}_j rather than explicitly computing the Jacobian, which will be less efficient in most cases.

body: This will be useful, but probably won't be implemented in near future. As is with most autodiff systems, PyTorch has the derivatives formulas for ops written as efficient mappings that do `g y -> gx = \{ \sum_i g y_i * d y_i / d x_j \}_j` rather than explicitly computing the Jacobian, which will be less efficient in most cases.
